1562000931_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
> [nofish](#comment_1279_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): There should be a possibility to enable that, but archiving the sites in a git (or similar) repository at every changes will take up significant resources.

I think the times at which a site is being archived should be configurable, I don't think archiving a site every day is that resource intensive. Git is a good solution.

1562511342_13UJZwpkQASN9unpc9hLhmwyauXzz.body:
All sites which use the same database schema can and should be combined together some day, like ZeroMe or other merged sites, to provide an RSS-like interface to new topics, blog posts, and other stuff.

The ZeroFrame API with admin capabilities and the `as` command can be used to create such a feature in ZeroHello, to start implementing it the ZeroHello home page will need to be forked and set as your homepage:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/#as
